ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned so much about the history of Yale's campus: both the overall story and about specific buildings and architects.  This class made the campus make sense and gave me a whole new perspective on the university I attend.  I also developed my visual literacy skills -- in general and for identifying architectural styles and features.

I never knew that I would be the kind of person to look at the architectural integrity of a building and notice things like window support, brick patterns, and veneer but now I am. I am a huge history person and I loved learning all the stories of Yale. I absolutely devoured the Pinnell readings each night. I also had the chance to explore a different college campus that I was interested in which I really appreciated. Overall, a great course.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: the topic of the course in general, the walking tour format, the readings, being an in-person class!

Could be improved: it would have been nice to have a little more time for discussion (but given the short time frame that also makes sense).  I also would have enjoyed spending a little of the first day on an introduction to architecture -- talking more about what architecture is as a discipline, how architects think and design, how to look at buildings, etc.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments:
Yes, I can't recommend it enough!!  I took this course on a whim and I am so glad I did.  This course was fascinating, engaging, and fun, without the stress or heavy workload.  I spent the whole summer telling everyone interesting facts I learned about campus buildings. 
I realized how much Yale's architecture was fooling me before this class.  Honestly every Yale student should take this course to gain a better familiarity with the behind-the-scenes stories on campus.

Absolutely! This course was the perfect course to take during summer session. It was my first in-person class here at Yale and it really helped me to get familiar with the campus. I learned so much about the school and its history and not just through lectures. Summer sessions are very quick so in five weeks there is only so much that you can uncover, but I felt that we did a great amount. I think that the workload of this course was ideal and exactly what I signed up for.

narratives.question_text: The Canvas course site allowed me to identify and access required course materials easily.

extras.title: ARCH S110 01 - Yale and the Academic Campus
